attributes.action: Abolish Mandatory Car Insurance: Restore Financial Freedom and Fairness
attributes.additional_details: Mandatory car insurance forces millions to pay rising premiums to profit-driven companies, often based on unfair factors like age or postcode. Hard-working people, especially young and low-income drivers, are priced off the road, limiting jobs and independence. Abolishing this mandate restores financial freedom, stops predatory pricing, and makes driving fair and accessible for all.
attributes.background: Abolish mandatory car insurance laws & allow drivers to prove financial responsibility via alternative means such as a bond, savings or deposit. This will give us the freedom to choose how we manage risk while ensuring accountability. We also urge Parliament to investigate unfair insurance pricing.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action: 

Remove requirement to have motor insurance unless you have past driving offences
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/707255
